song_weaving.name: Song Weaving
song_weaving.description: The most ancient form of magic, predating The Shattering. Practitioners create effects through specific melodies and harmonies rather than formal spellcasting.
song_weaving.origin: Song Weaving is the original form of magic used in Aetheris before The Shattering. It was taught directly by the Luminaries to the first inhabitants of the world, who discovered that certain melodies could tap into the natural magical currents that flowed through the land.
song_weaving.limitations: Requires vocal ability and musical aptitude. Effects are weaker when performed solo rather than in a group. Cannot be performed silently. Some complex effects require specific musical instruments as foci.
song_weaving.practitioners: Most commonly practiced among Elves, who have maintained the ancient traditions, and Maelstri, who naturally resonate with the harmonic frequencies. However, any race with sufficient musical talent can learn its basics.
song_weaving.cultural_significance: Song Weaving is revered as the purest form of magic, especially among older cultures. Annual music festivals in the Concordant Cities often feature Song Weaving performances, and the most skilled practitioners are highly respected across all planes.

Elf.bonus_effects: 10% increased potency of all Song Weaving spells

Maelstri.bonus_effects: Can maintain Song Weaving effects 25% longer than other races

harmonic_healing.name: Harmonic Healing
harmonic_healing.description: A soothing melody that accelerates natural healing processes in the target.

resonant_shield.name: Resonant Shield
resonant_shield.description: Creates a barrier of sound waves that deflects incoming attacks.

chorus_of_clarity.name: Chorus of Clarity
chorus_of_clarity.description: A harmonizing melody that clears the mind and enhances perception.

dirge_of_despair.name: Dirge of Despair
dirge_of_despair.description: A haunting melody that instills dread and weakens resolve.

planar_harmonization.name: Planar Harmonization
planar_harmonization.description: A complex melody that resonates with the natural frequencies of different planes, facilitating travel and communication between them.

song_of_mending.name: Song of Mending
song_of_mending.description: A gentle tune that repairs physical objects and mends broken items.

planar_anchoring.name: Planar Anchoring
planar_anchoring.description: The art of maintaining stability during Resonance Events. Practitioners can extend areas of stability or purposefully blur planar boundaries.
planar_anchoring.origin: Planar Anchoring emerged shortly after The Shattering as a necessity for survival. The Harmonic Order developed these techniques to protect settlements when the planes would temporarily merge, preventing catastrophic destruction.
planar_anchoring.limitations: Requires physical components from multiple planes. Creates significant mental strain on the caster, with prolonged use potentially causing 'planar sickness' - a condition where the practitioner begins to exist partially in multiple planes simultaneously.
planar_anchoring.practitioners: Primarily used by the Harmonic Order as part of their duty to protect settlements during Resonance Events. It is also practiced by planar researchers and certain specialized mages who study the boundaries between realities.
planar_anchoring.cultural_significance: Planar Anchors are highly respected in all societies, as they serve as protectors during dangerous Resonance Events. In the Concordant Cities, they hold positions of authority and are often consulted on matters of planar significance.

Human.bonus_effects: Can maintain anchoring effects 20% longer than other races

Prismal.bonus_effects: 15% reduced mana cost for planar anchoring spells

Maelstri.bonus_effects: Can detect planar instabilities within 50m radius

stability_field.name: Stability Field
stability_field.description: Creates a field where planar fluctuations are suppressed, providing safety during Resonance Events.

reality_tether.name: Reality Tether
reality_tether.description: Anchors a person or object to their home plane, protecting them from planar shifts and dimensional effects.

planar_sight.name: Planar Sight
planar_sight.description: Grants the ability to see planar boundaries, resonance patterns, and entities from other planes that might otherwise be invisible.

boundary_distortion.name: Boundary Distortion
boundary_distortion.description: Temporarily weakens planar boundaries in a small area, allowing for partial merging of planes or extraction of planar energy.

resonance_shield.name: Resonance Shield
resonance_shield.description: Creates a personal barrier that absorbs planar energy and harmful resonance effects.

planar_transit.name: Planar Transit
planar_transit.description: Creates a stable corridor between planes, allowing safe passage for a short time. Only works between planes currently in resonance.

echo_binding.name: Echo Binding
echo_binding.description: The art of capturing 'echoes' - residual effects from other planes that linger after Resonance Events - and binding them to objects or people to grant temporary planar properties.
echo_binding.origin: Echo Binding emerged from the opportunistic practices of scavengers who frequented areas after Resonance Events. They discovered that certain residual energies could be captured and preserved for later use, eventually developing sophisticated techniques to harness these 'echoes'.
echo_binding.limitations: Requires fresh echoes from recent Resonance Events. Prolonged use can cause 'planar bleeding' - uncontrolled manifestations of other planes. The practice is somewhat unstable; effects can be unpredictable if not properly controlled.
echo_binding.practitioners: Popular among independent magical practitioners, merchants specializing in unique magical items, and adventurers who need versatile magical effects without formal training. The Mercantile Chord employs many Echo Binders to create valuable cross-planar goods.
echo_binding.cultural_significance: Viewed with mixed opinions across cultures. Some see it as a practical adaptation to the post-Shattering world, while others consider it dangerous tampering with forces that should be left alone. There's a growing black market for illegal echo harvesting, particularly from dangerous or forbidden planes.

Human.bonus_effects: Can identify echo properties 25% more accurately than other races

Halfling.bonus_effects: Echo bindings last 15% longer when created by Halflings

Maelstri.bonus_effects: Can naturally sense echoes within 30m radius

echo_capture.name: Echo Capture
echo_capture.description: Captures a lingering planar echo and stores it temporarily for later use.

bind_echo.name: Bind Echo
bind_echo.description: Binds a captured echo to an object or person, transferring its planar properties.

echo_sight.name: Echo Sight
echo_sight.description: Grants the ability to see lingering echoes and assess their properties and potential uses.

weapon_echo.name: Weapon Echo
weapon_echo.description: Binds a combat-oriented echo to a weapon, granting it planar offensive properties.

echo_ward.name: Echo Ward
echo_ward.description: Creates a protective barrier using protective echoes, shielding against both physical and planar threats.

echo_mimicry.name: Echo Mimicry
echo_mimicry.description: Binds an entity echo to the caster, temporarily granting traits, abilities, or appearance of creatures from other planes.

facet_magic.name: Facet Magic
facet_magic.description: A precise form of magic developed by the Crystalline Consortium that uses geometric crystals to channel and focus magical energies with mathematical precision.
facet_magic.origin: Facet Magic was developed in the Crystalline plane after The Shattering. The Prismals, with their natural crystalline bodies, discovered they could channel magical energies through precisely cut geometric forms, leading to a highly structured and mathematical approach to spellcasting.
facet_magic.limitations: Requires precisely cut crystals as foci, with different shapes producing different effects. Demands mathematical precision and calculation. Less effective in chaotic environments or when crystals are damaged. Requires significant preparation and is difficult to use spontaneously.
facet_magic.practitioners: Primarily used by members of the Crystalline Consortium, especially Prismals and mathematically-inclined humans and dwarves. Requires formal education in crystalline geometry and facet theory, making it inaccessible to those without proper training.
facet_magic.cultural_significance: Facet Magic is seen as the most 'civilized' and scholarly form of magic within the Crystalline Consortium. Practitioners are viewed as elite intellectuals, and the precision of one's faceted crystals is a status symbol. Those who master this art often receive the honorific 'Facet' before their name.

Prismal.bonus_effects: 20% reduced mana cost for all Facet Magic spells

Dwarf.bonus_effects: Facet crystals crafted by Dwarves last 30% longer before needing recalibration

prismatic_bolt.name: Prismatic Bolt
prismatic_bolt.description: Creates a beam of concentrated light energy that strikes with geometric precision.

crystalline_shield.name: Crystalline Shield
crystalline_shield.description: Forms a perfect geometric barrier of faceted energy that absorbs damage.

computational_enhancement.name: Computational Enhancement
computational_enhancement.description: Enhances mental faculties through crystalline resonance with the brain's natural patterns.

perfect_analysis.name: Perfect Analysis
perfect_analysis.description: Uses crystalline resonance to perfectly analyze an object, creature, or phenomenon.

geometric_restructuring.name: Geometric Restructuring
geometric_restructuring.description: Manipulates the physical structure of non-living matter by precisely realigning its internal geometry.

crystal_prison.name: Crystal Prison
crystal_prison.description: Encases the target in a perfect crystalline structure that restricts movement.

ash_walking.name: Ash Walking
ash_walking.description: A unique form of magic from the Ashen plane that allows practitioners to temporarily transfer their consciousness into the Ashen plane for communication, espionage, and retrieving lost knowledge.
ash_walking.origin: Ash Walking developed among the nomadic societies of the Ashen plane as a means of maintaining communication across vast distances. After The Shattering, the Cinderspawn refined these techniques into a formal magical practice that allows consciousness to slip between the boundaries of physical existence.
ash_walking.limitations: Extended use causes physical body to gradually turn to ash. Risk of becoming lost in the Ashen plane increases with duration. Requires absolute concentration, making it vulnerable to interruption. Cannot interact physically with the material world while consciousness is transferred.
ash_walking.practitioners: Primarily practiced by members of the Ashen Covenant, especially Cinderspawn who have a natural affinity for the practice. Some secretive groups like assassins guilds have adopted modified versions for espionage purposes.
ash_walking.cultural_significance: Among the Ashen Covenant, Ash Walking is considered sacred, used in important ceremonies to commune with ancestors. Outside these communities, it is often viewed with suspicion or fear, associated with death magic and necromancy, though this is a misunderstanding of its true nature.

Cinderspawn.bonus_effects: Can maintain Ash Walking 50% longer without physical degradation

minor_projection.name: Minor Projection
minor_projection.description: Temporarily transfers a small portion of consciousness into the Ashen plane, allowing limited perception beyond physical barriers.

ashen_transit.name: Ashen Transit
ashen_transit.description: Fully transfers consciousness into the Ashen plane, leaving the physical body in a trance-like state.

whispers_of_ash.name: Whispers of Ash
whispers_of_ash.description: Allows communication through the Ashen plane to another individual, regardless of distance, so long as both parties have access to ash from the same source.

ashen_knowledge.name: Ashen Knowledge
ashen_knowledge.description: Accesses the collective memory of the Ashen plane to retrieve lost or forgotten knowledge about a specific subject or location.

ash_veil.name: Ash Veil
ash_veil.description: Creates a cloud of animate ash that obscures vision and can be mentally controlled by the caster.

ashen_body.name: Ashen Body
ashen_body.description: Temporarily transforms the caster's physical form into ash, allowing them to flow through small openings and resist physical damage.

divine_healing.name: Divine Healing
divine_healing.description: A sacred form of magic that channels divine energy to heal wounds, cure ailments, and restore life force. While healing effects can be achieved through other magical systems, Divine Healing is specifically focused on restoration and protection through spiritual connection.
divine_healing.origin: Divine Healing predates The Shattering, stemming from the earliest spiritual practices across all planes. After the cosmic trauma of The Shattering, these healing traditions became even more vital, with practitioners developing formalized methods to channel divine energies from fragmented Luminaries.
divine_healing.limitations: Requires genuine spiritual conviction or connection. Effectiveness is reduced when used for selfish purposes. Cannot typically restore life to the truly dead. More severe injuries require greater spiritual energy and preparation. Some ailments require specific divine connections or rituals.
divine_healing.practitioners: Most commonly practiced by clerics and spiritual leaders, though anyone with sufficient faith and training can learn its basics. The most powerful practitioners are those who maintain a deep connection with the fragmented Luminaries or other divine entities.
divine_healing.cultural_significance: Healing practitioners are highly respected in all societies, often serving both spiritual and medical roles in their communities. In many cultures, significant healing rituals mark important life transitions and community events. The ability to heal is seen as one of the most noble uses of magic.

Mycora.bonus_effects: Healing spells are 25% more effective when cast by Mycora

Human.bonus_effects: Can sense injuries and ailments within 10m radius

Elf.bonus_effects: Can maintain healing effects 20% longer than other races

healing_touch.name: Healing Touch
healing_touch.description: Channels divine energy through the caster's hands to heal wounds and injuries.

purify_body.name: Purify Body
purify_body.description: Cleanses the body of disease, poison, and other harmful substances through divine intervention.

divine_restoration.name: Divine Restoration
divine_restoration.description: A powerful healing spell that mends severe injuries, regenerates damaged tissue, and restores vitality.

circle_of_healing.name: Circle of Healing
circle_of_healing.description: Creates a sacred circle that radiates healing energy to all within its bounds.

protective_blessing.name: Protective Blessing
protective_blessing.description: Invokes divine protection to shield the target from harm and enhance their resilience.

revitalize.name: Revitalize
revitalize.description: Restores energy and vitality to the exhausted, removing fatigue and granting renewed strength.

metadata.description: Magic system definitions for the RPG game world
